headline: Helix Energy Lands Major Gulf Of America Contract, Shares Edge Higher
summary: Helix Energy Solutions Group, Inc. (NYSE:HLX) saw its shares rise in premarket trading Thursday following the announcement of a significant contract award. The offshore energy services provider confirmed it has signed a multi-year agreement with a major operator to deliver well intervention and abandonment work in the U.S. Gulf of America starting in 2026. The deal spans three years and guarantees a set level of vessel utilization. Also Read: Walmart CEO Says Tariff Costs Expected To Rise, Lower

The deal spans three years and guarantees a set level of vessel utilization. Also Read: Walmart CEO Says Tariff Costs Expected To Rise, Lower

headline: Helix Energy wins well intervention contract in Gulf of Mexico
summary: The agreement includes a minimum commitment of vessel utilisation spread over three years.

headline: Dividend Harvesting Portfolio Week 233: $23,300 Allocated, $2,478.50 In Projected Dividends
summary: Dividend Harvesting Portfolio continues to outperform, now up 31.13% with $2,478.50 in forward annualized dividend income. Read more on the portfolio here.
